ARABIC: إِن كُلُّ نَفْسٍ لَّمَّا عَلَيْهَا حَافِظٌ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: There is no self which has no guardian over it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: That over each soul there is a guardian.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: There is no living being but there is a protector over it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: There is no soul which is not guarded (by the two angels who record all of its deeds).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: There is not a soul that does not have a guardian over it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: There is no human being but has a protector over him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: There is not a soul but over it is a keeper.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Over every soul there is a watcher.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: No human soul but hath a guardian over it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: [for] no human being has been left unguarded.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: No soul is there but hath over it a watcher.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: there is a guard over every soul.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: There is no soul but has a protector over it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: There is no human being but has a protector over him (or her) (i.e. angels incharge of each human being guarding him, writing his good and bad deeds, etc.)
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: For every soul there is a watcher.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: There is no soul without a Protector over it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: There is no soul but that it has over it a protector.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [86:4] Over every soul there is a keeper (if read la-mā, then mā is extra, and in, is softened in place of the hardened form with its subject omitted, that is to say, innahu; the lām is [a particle] for separation; if read lammā, then in is for negation and lammā means illā, ‘except that’) — the watcher is an angel that keeps a record of its deeds, both the good and the evil.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (No human soul) no believing or disbelieving soul-this is why Allah swore-(but hath a guardian over it) who record its words and deeds until he drives it into the grave.
